creator: craigwblake@mac.com
text:
With a simple HTTP request if I select GET method it results in a malformed request being sent where 
the generated method is 'null'.  For example, given a GET request sampler for the URL 'http://test.com/
test' JMeter generates an actual request of 'null http://test.com/test' where it should be 'GET http://
test.com/test'.  This causes the remote server to disconnect.
Can you attach a sample test plan showing this problem please?
creator: sebb@apache.org

text:
From further investigation, it appears that the cause was running with "Automatically follow redirects" 
enabled and then having a redirect issued to a server that the test machine could not resolve.  This 
appears to cause the following request to be generated with a null method.

So, this appears to only be a bug insofar as it probably should detect that the server cannot be resolved 
or fail a bit more gracefully.
creator: craigwblake@mac.com
sebb@apache.org
text:
This now works OK (solved by fix to bug 30267) - unknown Host exception is
generated.
